channel.title: Tea With Alice
channel.itunes:subtitle: Alice Fraser
channel.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
channel.itunes:summary: Every week Alice Fraser, chronic thinker, comedian, ex lawyer and cambridge graduate drinks tea and solves the world. With producer Sean Michaels and occasional guests.
channel.description: Every week Alice Fraser, chronic thinker, comedian, ex lawyer and cambridge graduate drinks tea and solves the world. With producer Sean Michaels and occasional guests.

item.title: Twincast Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Double Trouble with the Fraser Twins
item.itunes:summary:
Alice talks to her twin brother in a cafe in Oxford about criticism, self-doubt and the self indulgence of kickstarter.
Sean's offline again this week, so sound quality is Alice-style, and we're rocking a slightly late release.
see Henry's music at http://henryfraser.com subscribe to the podcast in itunes, if you're enjoying it. Send feedback at @aliterative or alicerfraser@gmail.com
item.description:
Alice talks to her twin brother in a cafe in Oxford about criticism, self-doubt and the self indulgence of kickstarter.
Sean's offline again this week, so sound quality is Alice-style, and we're rocking a slightly late release.
see Henry's music at http://henryfraser.com subscribe to the podcast in itunes, if you're enjoying it. Send feedback at @aliterative or alicerfraser@gmail.com

item.title: Half-cast teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Twice the Tea, None of the Sean
item.itunes:summary:
All alone in England, Alice pulls a conversation out of the archives for the first Guest Teacast. With Scott Huntington, talking about men's rights activists, and deja-poo.
Find Scott's music online at http://listn.to/socalledfriend Alice is online at http://alicecomedyfraser.com
item.description:
All alone in England, Alice pulls a conversation out of the archives for the first Guest Teacast. With Scott Huntington, talking about men's rights activists, and deja-poo.
Find Scott's music online at http://listn.to/socalledfriend Alice is online at http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Teacast all the way to the Bank
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Catfished by a Corporation
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice talk about how corporations aren't people too, how it's not good to get too close to your money, and how to avoid a spiral of liking that ends in marriage.
(slightly shorter than usual, as Alice is in England and cut out a thing and couldn't figure out how to replace it with another thing)
alicecomedyfraser.com

alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Teacast Art Imitating Lifecast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Third Time Lucky
item.itunes:summary: Sean tells a joke that you will never hear, Alice rants about whether art is or is not a luxury and the urge to create or play video games. They reflect on corporate life.
item.description: Sean tells a joke that you will never hear, Alice rants about whether art is or is not a luxury and the urge to create or play video games. They reflect on corporate life.

item.title: Teacast predator vs alienation
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's be Positive (about consent)
item.itunes:summary: Strap yourselves in. Alice educates Sean about dubious consent, they talk about smoke and mirrors, the jazz hands part of sex and what happens when a bird flies into the window.
item.description: Strap yourselves in. Alice educates Sean about dubious consent, they talk about smoke and mirrors, the jazz hands part of sex and what happens when a bird flies into the window.

item.title: Post Christmas Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: The Birth of the Gripes Child
item.itunes:summary: Alice has tea with Sean. They talk about pride, love and loss, and school. Alice rants about goodwill to all mankind, and Sean talks about breakups with a friend.
item.description: Alice has tea with Sean. They talk about pride, love and loss, and school. Alice rants about goodwill to all mankind, and Sean talks about breakups with a friend.
